definitions.definition: to tie something tightly or to fasten something:
examples: They bound the packages with brightly coloured ribbon.
The things that bind them together are greater than their differences.

definitions.definition: To bind a part of the body, especially a part that is damaged, is to tie something around it:
examples: He had already bound the child's arm when I arrived.

definitions.definition: to sew or stick material along the edges of something such as a jacket, in order to make it stronger or to decorate it
to make separate pieces of paper into a book:
examples: There are several different ways to bind a book, for example you can stitch or stick the pages together.

definitions.definition: When an egg or water is used, especially in cooking, to bind something, it provides a way of making everything stick together in a solid mass:
a difficult or annoying situation in which you are prevented from acting as you might like:
examples: Having to visit her every week is a terrible bind.
